title: Brick Lane.avi
description:
This superb British 2007 film tells the story of a Bengali woman by the name of Nazneen, who grew up in rural Bangladesh, and moved to east London's Brick Lane at the age of 17, with her 'arranged' husband, who was twice her age (lucky git that he was). 

Married to a man she doesn't love, she lives vicariously through the images created by letters from her sister at 'home' in Bangladesh. The film picks up the story with the couple having lived in a small, drab, council flat for 18 years and had two daughters. Nazneen is filled with desire when a young, cocky, good-looking clothing worker visits her house.

It's a great insight into the East End Bangladeshi community, as well as extremely good watching.

I recorded this from the Film 4 TV channel, using EyeTV, from which I exported it as a pretty good quality .avi file. And I have edited out all the annoying bloody adverts (I think I zapped them all, hope so).

Big-budget Hollywood films just don't cut it compared to quality European output, do they? Load of rubbish in the main...
